text: Joseph de Toro was mayor of Ponce, Puerto Rico, starting in 1710.Ponce. Puerto Rico Encyclopedia. ==Background== De Toro was capitán de granaderos (herdsmen captain), a governmental position, during the 1812 mayoral administration of Jose Ortiz de la Renta.Eduardo Neumann Gandia. Verdadera y Autentica Historia de la Ciudad de Ponce. Ponce, Puerto Rico. 1913. San Juan, PR: Instituto de Cultura Puertorriqueña. 1987. pp. 47-48. == Mayoral term == Eduardo Neumann Gandia states that Joseph de Toro was mayor of Ponce starting in 1710. It is not known with certainty, however, when De Toro ended his mayoral term. However, it is likely he was still the mayor of Ponce three years later when Puerto Rico governor Francisco Danío Granados ordered, in 1713, that together with those of Coamo, Guaynabo, Caguas, Loiza and Santurce, the hato and estancia owners in the Ponce were to contribute a tax for the reconstruction of the San Antonio bridge in San Juan.Aida R. Caro Costas. El Cabildo o Regimen Municipal Puertorriqueño el el Siglo XVIII: La Gestión Municipal Puertorriqueña. (Tomo II). San Juan, PR: Instituto de Cultura Puertorriqueña. 1974. p. 116. ==See also== * List of Puerto Ricans * List of mayors of Ponce, Puerto Rico ==References== Category:Year of birth unknown Category:Year of death unknown Category:Mayors of Ponce, Puerto Rico
title: Joseph de Toro
